dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane, now level, crashes into the ground and comes t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke. Flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary jumps out of the cockpit and rushes back to Shep who clamber out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep! Shep, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't make it, Cary. Can't make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, give me your arm! I'll get  you out of here! Hang on there,  Shep! Get a hold - Just hold tight,  old fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary pulls Shep out and hauls him away from the burning w of them collapse to the ground, half-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flames consume the plane.

dialogues.text: for Lieutenant Shep Lambert, a patient at U.S. Army A.E.F Shep's temperature readings for October 11th to October 2 a line on a graph, near a level marked CRITICAL. The dist continues to RUMBLE.

dialogues.text: swings into view. This one is for Lieutenant Cary Lockwoo October 27th to November 2nd are also below the CRITICAL continues and improves considerably by November 11th when marked NORMAL.

Cary has a coat drap glances off. We follow his gaze, PANNING past other patie to a wall clock and calendar. It is November 11th and the eleven A. M. The battle's RUMBLE drones on.

dialogues.text: stare up at the clock. Behind his dark glasses, Shep's le

The center of up exactly with the center of the propeller -- the slowin are replaced by the clock's hands -- as if to symbolicall war has ended but time goes on. The NOISE of battle fades of the clock remains. DISSOLVE TO the calendar: November Armistice Day.

dialogues.speaker: SHEP AND CARY
dialogues.text: sit motionless side-by-side on the cot. Shep has a hand o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the old guerre is finie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are ya gonna do now, Shep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to him) And then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep lets go of his eye and looks at Cary as if the answe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary grins wryly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nurse opens a door for Shep and Cary who enter. Shep we Cary carries his coat to hide his hands. They pause as th passed through close behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their distinguished-looking doctor, a medical officer wit his uniform, sits at his desk studying their papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenants Lambert and Lockwood.  (rises, joins them) You two leaving us, eh? In a way,  I'm sorry to release you two. I have  no choice in the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep removes his glasses and presses his hand to his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I going to do, Major, about  my-- oh, this rotten business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor examines Shep's eye more closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm? Spasmodic twitching of the  muscles under the eye, eh,  Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the French call a tic. T-I-C,  tic. Little bothersome, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep puts his glasses back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid time'll have to take care  of that. Time and normal living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep's lips tighten skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are returning to the United  States, I presume?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep glances at Cary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, we haven't decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd take the first boat home. Well,  here you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor gives Shep his release form and shakes his han shake Cary's. Cary merely looks down darkly and raises a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I forgot your burnt hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor folds up the release and stuffs it in Cary's b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither of you is fully hospitalized.  I'd undertake a systematic course of  finger exercises -- to, uh, stretch  them and loosen them up. In time,  you'll regain their full use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor gives Cary a pat on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary manages a smile and salutes. Shep moves to the door,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Lieutenant. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep opens the door and he and Cary head out. After the d doctor rubs his head thoughtfully. He talks, apparently,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there they go. Out to face  life.  (shakes his head) And their whole training was in  preparation for death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves off as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep and Cary exit the building but pause outside the doo something coming toward them and glance at one another be its path. They watch glumly as a small group of wounded s some metal gates, walk slowly past Shep and Cary without head into the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office window opens. The doctor -- no longer in white uniform -- and his aide take a break, standing in the win little fresh air. The doctor smokes a cigarette as they d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't they go on with flying?  You know, the air mails or  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid they're unfit for further  service in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aide looks at him, quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fell, you know -- six thousand  meters.  (shakes his head, sadly) Like dropping a fine Swiss watch on  the pavement. Shattered both of them.  Their nervous systems are deranged,  disorganized, brittle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spent bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spent bullets. That's it.  (nods) They're like projectiles, shaped  for war and hurled at the enemy.  (gestures with cigarette) They've described a beautiful, high-arching trajectory. And now  they've fallen back to earth.  Spent. Cooled off. Useless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly PULL BACK from the two men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, if they take care of  themselves, they'll pull through  all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if they do take care of  themselves, what good are they?  What can you expect of them?  (shakes his head) I hate to think what may become  of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have pulled back far enough and now we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two uniformed men with familiar faces -- exuberant pilot gunner Francis -- arrive at the bottom of the stairs in f Bill, with his arm in a sling, and Francis, using a cane, and wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Texas accent) Hello, Cary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Cary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the stairs, Shep and Cary wave back, please

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Bill! Hiya, Francis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Bill! Francis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unexpectedly, Shep and Cary hurry down the stairs past th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) Well, I see you got yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) Yup. We crashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Francis watch, surprised, as Shep and Cary hurry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls down, puzzled) Hey! Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep and Cary, already seated in the back of a waiting au kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the stairs, Francis smokes a cigarette and looks dow uncertainly. But Bill takes the news in stride -- he smil at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you in Paris!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waves his cigarette) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling, Shep and Cary wave back as their car drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A superimposed text reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic noise, taxi horns squeaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strolling down the sidewalk four abreast, as if they own heroes -- Bill, Shep, Francis and Cary -- in smart hats a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outwardly, they seem to have recovered from their wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep still wears his dark glasses and we occasionally gli twitching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary's bandages are gone but he has not regained full use personality is dark and dry, more subdued than Shep's, an the most levelheaded, rational member of the group -- its leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis seems to have suffered the greatest toll psycholo narcoleptic, strangely detached and unemotional much of t the verge of dozing off, his speech slurs even when he is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the athlete of the group, Bill -- a burly Texan whos William Talbot -- is in outstanding physical shape. But h restless, and temperamental, covering up unnamed insecuri forced exuberance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout a cocktail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad idea at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a group, they turn and head into a nearby building.

dialogues.speaker: A GLOWING SIGN
dialogues.text: made of light bulbs, outside the building. It spells out popular Parisian drinking establishment for Anglo-America

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numerous shelves holding numerous bottles of liquor. Empl jackets hurriedly rush in and pull down a few bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is packed with well-dressed men and women. The men (and men only, for no women are allowed to sit at Cla drinking, conversing. At the end of the PAN, we discover greeted by an employee who takes their hats.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VIEW
dialogues.text: An attractive young woman with a wide, vacant stare stand opposite the bar holding a champagne glass in her hands. she seems to be in a world all to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our four handsome heroes file past her, intent on finding pays any attention to Nikki. After they have all passed h and stare. She's extremely nearsighted and doesn't notice glass in her hand, puzzled. He starts off but then pauses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a second uncertain look, he moves off to join his f together and peer around the crowded room, unable to find keeps looking at Nikki. He glances at the others and they

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: still wearing a blank expression, clutches the glass in t

dialogues.speaker: THE GLASS
dialogues.text: in her hands. Between her fingers, we glimpse its content of men's false teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK to discover that Cary has approached her. He next to her and is staring at the glass. She finally noti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon. But, if I'm not  too inquisitive, would you mind  telling me what IS that you're  drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After another look, Cary turns to his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's teeth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teeth?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep, Bill and Francis hurry over like children and crowd amazement at the teeth. Nikki is unimpressed by all the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teeth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastic) Yup. It's a full set -- upper and  lower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nikki) It's a nice expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how come you're with those  teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just standing here. And a nice  gentleman came along and begged my  pardon and asked would I mind  holding his teeth for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what did he want you to hold  his teeth for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said he wanted to biff somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Biff somebody?! Which way did he go?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just around to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, men! We're liable to see a  fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As quickly as they arrived, Shep, Bill and Francis depart them but stops to politely address Nikki who has gone bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to come along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if it were obvious) Oh, no. I have to stay here and mind  the man's teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They glance down at the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary hurries off as Nikki's empty eyes rise to the ceilin

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: as it takes a combination one-two punch from a pair of fi

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: dropping unconscious to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: OUR FOUR HEROES
dialogues.text: enter a hallway just in time to see two Claridge's employ haul away the unconscious body. Our heroes have missed th Bill are delighted anyway. Bill brushes his hands (one of gestures) with satisfaction, as if he had thrown the punc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. THAT'S all fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill straightens his bow-tie. Already the group seeks a n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head back to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: THE BAR
dialogues.text: Nikki, no longer standing against the wall, sits on a bar to the countertop, smoking a cigarette and holding an emp Our heroes enter and, glancing at the wall, fail to see h searching, Cary spots her at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four crowd around her, pleased to be in her company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we missed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did something happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they carried a guy out. (sees her empty glass) Say! What's become of the teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the man came and got his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said thank you for holding his  teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he fell in an airplane in  the war -- and got his teeth knocked  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why do you think he was in the  war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he had a kind of little striped  ribbon in his buttonhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think he was a flyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes?  (dry, to the others) You can tell a flyer better by his  ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you say we have a  drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, here's some space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seats have opened up at the bar so they grab stools next the bartender:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jean!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon soir, Monsieur Lambert.  Qu'est-ce que voulez-vous [?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martiniiii!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I have a champagne cocktail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainment, Mademoiselle.  (calls off) Quatre Martinis pour messieurs!  Champagne cocktail pour Mademoiselle  Nikki!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are all excited to find out her name. Francis use monocle to eye Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time this evening, Shep takes off his dark

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine that, fellas? Her  name is Nikki!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers the situation) Her name is Nikki. She holds men's  teeth. She sits at the bar and she  drinks champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (significantly) Boys, she's gonna be a lot of  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinks are served. A moment of silence as they imbibe. Ni she lifts her glass, spilling some champagne. She laughs,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my, my!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep, who has been watching her closely, also laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor sweet! She can't even hold her  glass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki notices Cary unsteadily using both his hands to hol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) Oh, well, HE can't either. Besides,  he has to use two hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki chuckles. A dark look crosses Cary's face as he loo down his drink. Seeing this, Bill and Francis exchange wo abruptly rises and leaves the bar. Mystified, Nikki looks who is suddenly grim and annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course he can't hold his glass. His  hands are burned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no right to spill YOUR  drinks. He can't help himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burned? How burned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brought a plane down on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An airplane? In the war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep demonstrates with his hands as he explains:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He held the stick. But his hands  began to slip. Then he held it  inside his arms. He was trying to  bring his rear gunner down alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he bring him down safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep takes a swallow of his Martini, sets down the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so that's why--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! That's why he can't hold a  glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm so ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Cary's had a pretty thin time.  His nerves are tricky. You should  never call attention to his hands.

dialogues.speaker: AT A TABLE
dialogues.text: Cary sits with a fresh drink and is trying awkwardly to p handsome but humorless American journalist -- the unspeak and greets him casually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Cary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unhappily) Oh, hello, Frink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary immediately turns his attention to a menu. Rebuffed, to the bar and sees the other men. He has a friendly pat Francis and Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Francis. Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink pauses to stare at Nikki's back, astonished to find the bar. Then he turns to Shep, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep. Drunk again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, don't you know any OTHER  opening remarks? It's about all  we've heard from you for a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (signals the bartender) Hi! Jean!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink snaps his fingers at Jean and grabs a seat next to Frink's order in French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un sidecar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidecar ... [?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean moves off. Frink regards the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, why don't you fellows go home  and go to work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work? What kind of work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, anything useful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could we do? Sell washing  machines? Drive a milk wagon? Mend  old furniture or somethin'? Heh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to flying. Fly the air  mails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, we couldn't fly a kite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a small kite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis holds his fingers to indicate a very small kite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there must be something you  can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to tend to our drinking.  We don't get much opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of things going on outside.  Sun shining, trees growing, people  walking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say! Is that STILL going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)  Sounds pretty pre-war to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During all this, Nikki has been in her own little world. whispers to Shep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Don't I rate an introduction?  Who's your swell friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, her? Just an old hussy we found  scattered around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around her neck, on a slender chain, Nikki carries a smal with a spring and has small rectangular lenses. She uses peering at unfamiliar objects in her helpless, nearsighte remark, she whips it out to stare at him, mildly offended to his lips and turns to her, speaking out of the side of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Frink) Pay no attention. Sometimes he goes  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki looks away glumly as Shep grins at her. She turns a She raises her lorgnette for a better look at:

dialogues.speaker: CARY
dialogues.text: who sits at his table, staring into space, holding his un

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: is pleased to see Cary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! He didn't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises to join him.

dialogues.speaker: CARY
dialogues.text: startled, rises and stares at Nikki as she approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm so sorry. Your hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to take his hands but he pulls them away in hor in his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, your poor hands! Your poor, poor  hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wildly uncomfortable, Cary glances around like a cornered stalks away without a word, hands still stuffed in his po watches him exit the building. She realizes she's done so wrong and moves to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Shep intercepts her. Upset, she whimpers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more in disbelief  than anger) If you aren't the WORST! First, you  insult his hands and make him mad.  Then you cry over them and make him  self-conscious. Come on back here.  Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clasps her hand and leads her to:

dialogues.speaker: THE BAR
dialogues.text: Francis and Bill watch, disturbed, as Shep guides a cryin beside them. Shep sits next to her as she continues to so compact to fix her tear-stained face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's torn it. He'll never  come back now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll have to find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To explain how sorry I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused at her  distress) We-ell. You don't have to get so  emotional about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's getting emotional?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are. You're coming all apart.  (hands her a glass) Here. Take a drink of this. Make  you laugh and play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki takes a sip, then busies herself with putting away Meanwhile, Bill leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Shep) Say, what's she crying about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's crying on account of they  didn't wash her strawberries this  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nikki) Didn't they wash your strawberries  this morning? Well, there ain't a  whole hell of a lot that we can do  about that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agrees, sadly) No.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VIEW
dialogues.text: Frink watches suspiciously as Shep pays the tab, rises an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki obediently hops off her stool and Shep leads her aw toward the exit. Bill and Frink are distressed to see her Shep:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Where're you goin'?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises) Out where?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out to get a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill gestures grandly toward the bar with its many shelve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you suppose you could arrange  that here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. We gotta go somewheres else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without missing a beat) Okay. Come on, Francis. We got to go  somewheres else to get a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis and Bill head out the door. After a moment, Frink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi cab -- filled with Bill, Francis, Shep, Nikki and a restaurant. As it stops, Bill rises and points to someo table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! There he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group cheers, spills out of the taxi and heads for:

dialogues.speaker: THE SIDEWALK TABLE
dialogues.text: where Cary sits reading a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary looks up. He rises, a little startled, and politely others crowd around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, what are you tryin' to do,  disown us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely polite) Hello. Won't you sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure we'll sit down. What'd ya think  we'd do? Stand around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all take seats around the little table. During this, for Nikki who grabs a seat of her own. When he tries to u her, Bill commandeers it for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a wave, to Frink) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiter joins them as they settle in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Cary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Shep. Hello, Nikki. What will  you have to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quatre Martinis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, could I have champagne, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Champagne? Oui.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter departs. Off her order, Bill gives Nikki a loo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, she's goin' to be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explains, to Bill) That's what I started on.  (to Cary) It upsets me if I change over to  anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bill) There's a lot of things wrong with  this one.  (to Nikki) What were you doing at the bar at  Claridge's anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Don't you know you're not  supposed to be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a sign on the wall says  ladies must sit at the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't read signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll just have to take care  of her, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think she's good-lookin'  enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know I'm not very good- looking but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when I was a little girl, my  mother always said I had the nicest  hair-ribbon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep laughs derisively. The others give him a look and he arrive. All the men, save Cary, snatch up their glasses. toothpicked olive and swallows his Martini whole. He watc champagne's drinking straw between her hands as if she we to start a fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there's her drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with my drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a sissy drinker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I can improve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Cary attempts -- with some success -- to drink unsteady hand. Bill inspects Nikki's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there's her teeth. Why, one of  'em is turned sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points) You mean this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you have it turned around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it turned around on  account of it's a kind of help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in what respect does it kind  of help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you see, when anyone kisses me  too hard, it splits my lip. And you  could tell when anyone kissed me too  hard on account of my lip would  bleed. So now I don't let anyone  kiss me -- hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are amused. Nikki sips her champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll let that pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill chuckles. Shep abruptly rises and walks off, presuma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep went off to sharpen his skates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, about your nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my nose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't straight. It kind of turns  up at the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when I was a little girl, I  got bumped by a swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you happen to get bumped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just walked through the gate. I  was only seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, poor dear. Didn't you see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see very far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It made me dizzy all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess we can't hold that  against her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all make mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Michelangelo painted  Adam with a navel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Nikki laugh at this. Suddenly, Nikki grows thoug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the same, he'd look funny the  other way -- even in a painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all consider this for a moment as a fresh round of d abruptly rises and walks off, presumably to the rest room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went off to shave a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got a husband or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, yes. But we haven't met in  quite a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not in a long time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, on account of my mother's name  was Beulah. Now, you can't have a  mother named Beulah. So I changed it  to Jane. And that's how it all began.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An odd CHIMING sound distracts them. They look off to see

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: the narcoleptic, arms folded, asleep in his chair. He awa pulls a pocket watch from inside his jacket, opens it, an chiming ends and he rises without a word and exits.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Nikki watches Francis' exit curiously. Bill waves her off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's goin' off to tame an alligator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis used to fly with us in the  94th. The best shot in the squadron.  Brought down twelve planes. Used to  call him "Sudden Death." He lost  interest after his teammate got  killed. He's lonesome is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He carries a chiming watch on  account of he's always falling  asleep in the daytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of chimes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Westminster, Canterbury, and  Whittington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take vanilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary puts a fist on his hip and gives Nikki an exasperate squeak. Francis, Shep and Frink return from their various down as Bill gives Nikki his opinion of Francis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's a washout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just because you're a big  bombardier and an All-American--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) All-American what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Montana State or somewhere.  Idaho or Nebraska or the Carlisle  Indians or something. Didn't you  never read about Bill? Bronko Bill  -- the Alabama Flash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill grins as Nikki inspects him closely through her lorg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) I think it's a forgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill's face falls. He looks at Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say! What do you want me to do?  Tackle a horse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. Shep is amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Go ahead. Tackle a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a dismissive wave) All right, all right, I'll tackle a  horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep looks down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes one now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look to see:

dialogues.speaker: A HORSE-DRAWN CAB
dialogues.text: rolling down the street in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Everyone watches as Bill rises and suddenly bolts in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out, horse!

dialogues.speaker: THE HORSE-DRAWN CAB
dialogues.text: rolling along as Bill runs in and tackles the horse, lock around the animal's front legs to trip up the poor creatu

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SIDEWALK
dialogues.text: Cary, horrified, stands and yells:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bill! Bill! Come back here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary runs off, toward Bill, leaving a thrilled Shep and a a distressed Nikki. They all stare in concerned amazement pedestrians stops to watch the excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught) Oh, Bill!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE HORSE-DRAWN CAB
dialogues.text: Cary rushes up to the startled cab driver who is pulling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What's the idea -- runnin'  down my friend like that? Here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary forces a wad of francs into the driver's hand. The c French but takes the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the fallen horse as the driver descends from the cab. tries to haul the horse to its feet while Cary tries to p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. Look where you're going  in the future now. You just watch out  where you're going!

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VIEW
dialogues.text: Bill grabs the horse by its bridle and tries to pull it u annoyed, gets up on its own and shakes its head violently Bill hangs on and tries to calm the horse. Cary tries to Frink, Francis and the driver gather around. Bill is more petting the horse which understandably shies away from hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (admonishes Bill) Now listen, come on out here, you  old fool.  (to the shying horse) Whoa, whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice horsie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bill) Now, listen, you ought to be ashamed  of yourself. You old fool! You know  what you'll do? You'll kill yourself  one of these days. Now, come on, get  out of here. Now, listen--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied with the outcome of all this, Bill heads back f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the driver) You all right now, brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver nods but is more concerned with reining in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Now, you just keep your  horse, see? You got your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabbie salutes Cary but pays more attention to his ho

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE SIDEWALK TABLE
dialogues.text: The waiter sets out a fresh round of drinks as the group dusts off the sleeve of his dinner jacket. Cary, beside h seat. They all sit down under the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, listen, Bill, you're All- American, see? You're TWO All- Americans! The lady's convinced  you're the whole team. You don't  have to tackle any more horses.  How 'bout that? Drink your drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased with himself) Ahhh. Wasn't that a great spill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki abruptly rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you all excuse me for a  moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a grave announcement) To take a Chinese singing lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis immediately understands that she's become one of olive in the air and cheers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men rise and all but Frink cheer her lustily as she d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooray! Hooray! Hooray! Hooray!

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: walks proudly into the restaurant as the men cheer. A smi directs her to the ladies' room.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Frink watches Nikki disappear from view and, after a glan rises and follows her. Shep, Bill and Cary remain at the drinking. Bill turns to Cary with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. What kind of a girl do you  think Nikki is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary glances in Nikki's direction and tells Bill confiden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's the kind that sits  down on phonograph records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill thinks about this and nods.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE RESTAURANT
dialogues.text: As Nikki returns from her Chinese singing lesson, Frink p wall, blocking her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Nikki, let's ditch these  drunks and go off somewhere by  ourselves. These crazy fools are  liable to do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful) Do you think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the war, they don't care what  happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll say so. I've got more  important things to think of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What more important things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, my work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the foreign correspondent for a  New York newspaper syndicate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely) How nice for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki pushes his arm away and heads for the table. Frink dark look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE SIDEWALK TABLE
dialogues.text: The men rise briefly as Nikki rejoins them and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki? Are you the kind of girl that  sits down on phonograph records?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki lowers her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit defensively) People shouldn't leave their records  lying about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Francis) What did I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abruptly brightens) Take me dancing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What place you wanna go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What places you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we got Maxim's, only it's too  early. We've got Florida, Perroquet,  Pigalle, Le Rat Mort, Moulin Rouge,  Bal Tabarin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take vanilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary gives her a look. Bill clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody pay for the drinks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill rises and claps his hands with enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're off in a "billizzard" of  horse-radish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever that means. The men rise and retrieve their hats

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A festive Parisian night spot. Dance MUSIC plays while a moving spotlights, unfurls in the huge, darkened ballroom crowded tables. A handsome male dancer, in tuxedo and top exuberantly around the floor, surrounded by beautiful cho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere above all this, Nikki, lit by spotlight flashes a ringside balcony observing the show with eager interest lorgnette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The show continues: after a few twirls, the dancer links to form a line and do some precision high-kicking. The mu dance apparently ends and the lights come up. Impressed,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, my! Isn't this nice?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, the men sit at a roped-off table for six on a low Francis sit glumly on one side of the table as Bill tries the others (Frink; a nameless young woman nicknamed "Kiss appears in this scene only; Shep and Nikki).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, listen, men. I'll tell ya  something funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary and Francis look doubtful about this. Bill sits at t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was only four years old once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cary) What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said he was only four years old  once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my aunt had a very low-neck  dress on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cary) What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said his aunt had on a very low-neck  dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she sat right across the table  in front of me. And I said, "Auntie  -- I can see your knees!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody laughs or even changes expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly, after  an awkward pause) I wonder what's doing in Portugal  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill is disappointed at the response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'd better do my match trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you do match tricks, I'll recite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recite what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
