dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Well, come on, men. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phonograph music plays as an Asian maid, the hotel's spec Pedicure, paints Nikki's toenails. We PAN UP to discover sitting in a chair next to the phonograph, smoking a ciga the progress of her paint job. A snappy knock at the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) Entrez!

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: opens and Bill, looking dapper, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Nik!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, Shep enters, wearing his dark eyeglasses and carryi flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Nikki!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next, Francis enters, sleepily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mid-yawn)  Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Cary, who closes the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are all: wearing suits and ties, pleased to see h Francis finds his way to the sofa, which has been returne in the room. He lies down and shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Bill. Hello, Shep. Hello,  Cary. Hello, Francis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the sofa) Morning, Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't expect to see you all so  early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep puts the flowers in a vase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We camped on your doorsteps last  night. And this morning we all moved  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary leans over her affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite your practically innumerable  faults, we adore you. We've decided  to adopt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Shep kneel next to Nikki. Bill notices the toena

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for heaven's sakes! Look at  Nikki! What are you having done to  yourself, gal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha having your toes painted  for, Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary stands behind Nikki as she looks down at her toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  (looks at Bill and Shep) Seemed like a good idea at the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary smiles. Nikki, Bill and Shep share a laugh. The Asia painting as Bill and Shep study Nikki's legs. During this cigarette to Cary who moves to put it in an ashtray by th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, look at Nikki's legs, would  you? That there is practically the  loveliest pair of legs I ever saw in  all my born days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like my legs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary stares out the window at a rainy day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at those legs, Cary. My, they  nearly match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary turns from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever see such a swell set of  legs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you want me to do  about it? Burst into tears?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it embarrass you, Nikki, if  Cary were to burst into tears?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her legs) On account of my legs? Oh! (turns to Cary, heartfelt) I think that would be sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary manages a slight grin. As he does, there's a knock a hollers, "Entrez!" Shep runs to the door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy! Here come the drinks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others cheer happily. Two hotel employees enter carry already poured drinks. Shep hands a glass to Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Nikki, drink this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make you laugh and play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I want to do, laugh and  play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep hands Bill a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis sits groggily on the sofa, a drink in each hand. and then the other. He leans over and sets one empty glas holds on to the other as he puts his head to the nearby p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary, Bill and Shep crowd around Nikki who is still seate The tray-carrying hotel employees have apparently exited. toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to Nikki's dainty legs. As  smooth and hairless as an egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drink. Another knock at the door. They all yell, "En to reveal Frink -- whose face falls when he sees the othe others are not happy to see him, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! Here comes that licentious  old man. Who invited him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary hands his glass to Bill and moves to meet Frink as h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sneering) Still drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head  mockingly) How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary watches Frink approach Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a pause, Nikki looks up at him uncertainly as if sh him. Then she peers at him through her lorgnette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's you.  (after a pause, reluctantly polite) Won't you sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink moves off to find a chair. Shep sets down his drink Frink starts to move a chair but Shep stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, I don't think Nikki likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. What do you wanna hang around  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do YOU hang around for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Why, I came to bring Nikki some  posies. I'll bet you didn't bring  Nikki any posies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-- Well--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the above dialogue, Bill nudges Cary mischievously at the tray in front of them. They exchange knowing nods, bring them over, and offer one to Frink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cure the shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't got the shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see. Hold out your hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Shep watch with interest as Frink holds out his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, turn them over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink turns them over, palms down. Cary looks at Frink's impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, that's pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary looks down at the drink in his own hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see if you can hold this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary sets the glass on top of Frink's downturned hand. Fr glass with ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, that's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary places a second full glass on Frink's other hand. Fr glasses with ease. Cary expresses keen admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady as a rock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink looks at the others, a little smugly. Cary slowly b off, as do the others. Frink's face falls as he realizes standing in the middle of the room with two drinks balanc hands and no way to safely remove them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary, Shep and Bill return to Nikki and crowd around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess that'll keep his hands  out of mischief for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink, abandoned, reluctantly pleads with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Take these off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the others simply ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's see. Where were we before  we were so rudely interrupted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were talkin' about Nikki's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. We were talkin' about  Nikki's legs. And havin' a fine time,  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Asian maid who has been working on Nikki's feet abrup

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men cheer, "Yay!" and Nikki smiles at the woman as sh tools. The men crowd closer to peer down at Nikki's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's inspect the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Nikki quickly covers her toes with a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my poor toes. Don't look too  close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki wraps her robe around her legs and stuffs them unde no longer using her footstool, Cary commandeers it and si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's the matter with your  toes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki grows extremely somber and begins to tell a story - eyes stare into space and her voice conveys terrible sadn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... when I was a little girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worried look crosses Cary's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... my mother bought me a new pair  of shoes. ... And they were WAY too  short. ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep and Bill listen soberly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And I had to walk all the way to  Sunday school and back. ... Down the road. ... And it was hot and dusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hand to his face) Oh, take her away! She's breakin'  my heart! (sobs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when I got home ...  my toes  were spoiled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the verge of tears) Oh, dear, oh, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's such a sad story. Let's all  have a drink, quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes pop. The men jump up eagerly and run off. Nikk nonplussed by this, takes a sip of her drink. Shep, Cary a tray and start imbibing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Frink looks around unsuccessfully for a way to that are still balanced on his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time in this scene, Nikki is on her feet. S drink tray and puts a friendly hand on the shoulders of S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now would you all excuse me?  On account of I'm gonna put on a  dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki walks off, exiting into her bedroom. The men contin the tray, drinking. In the background, Francis sleeps on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over by the fireplace, a frustrated Frink, still balancin casts a dirty look at the others. He angrily hurls the gl fireplace, smashing them loudly. Francis, startled awake off the sofa. The others stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, my. What's HE getting so excited  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink, furious, rubs his hands with a handkerchief and st pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys think you're so darn smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep, Bill and Cary laugh at this. Cary consults his pock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, cheerio, fellas. I'm off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill waves goodbye. Cary eats a last olive, tosses the to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary exits as Nikki's voice drifts in from:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the plans for the day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep, drink in hand, enters and leans on the wall outside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, on account of it's raining and  everything, we thought we'd go over  to the Cluny and play billiards and  drink beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Cary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Went to get his hat and coat. He's  going to PГЁre Lachaise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PГЁre Lachaise? What's PГЁre Lachaise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cemetery. How 'bout you coming  with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm going with Cary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) You've been invited?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki appears in the doorway, dressed to go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think Cary might object?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have an idea he'd like to be  alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Cary likes to be alone. He's  as brittle as a breadstick. One  silly crack from you and he might  break up in sections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks about this) Well, then, I don't think he should  be left alone.  (beat)  Tell me, what's Cary doing in Paris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we all doing in Paris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But why doesn't he go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's not ready to go home.  What could he do if he went home?  Have people cry over his hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it seems - a pity to go on  like this. He's such a sweet soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't he just sort of wasting  himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary. He's trying awfully  hard to get hold of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost in thought, Nikki moves off and a worried Shep follo

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Shep stops Nikki from leaving. She's a little downcast as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, listen. If you tag along, for  heaven's sake, be careful what you  say. Don't start getting sorry for  him and don't cry over him.  (with a chuckle) And, above all, don't make any  unfortunate remarks, hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (earnest) Oh, I won't. Why, who ever heard of  such a thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki opens the front door and exits into:

dialogues.speaker: THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: where Cary -- carrying coat, hat and cane -- emerges from hall from Nikki's and heads for the elevator. He stops wh calling to him. She runs to join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary?! Cary? I'm coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without waiting for a reply, she starts for the elevator, down at her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh!  (to Cary) Ooh, wait for Nikki!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves him and runs back to:

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: of her suite where Shep still stands. He watches with sur in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls back to Cary) Wait for Nikki!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puzzled, Shep follows Nikki who rushes to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki draws the curtain to reveal her enormous collection shoes. Shep, drink in hand, wanders in slowly and leans a as he watches Nikki pull off one pair of shoes and put on identical pair of red ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you changing your shoes  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On account of I can walk faster in  red shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep watches her hop and scurry off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passerbys carry umbrellas on this rainy day. A taxi cab p cafГ© -- LA REGENCE, according to the awning that covers tables. Cary emerges from the cab and pays off the driver under the awning. Cary joins her and, after a word to the ici."), looks at the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nikki) Perhaps we'd better stay here a  while till it clears up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we sit down here, do you  suppose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. Would you like something  to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move toward the cafГ©. As Cary hangs up his hat, a w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I drink now, do you  suppose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary orders the drinks as Nikki moves to sit at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the waiter) Deux picon citrons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter acknowledges this and heads inside, calling ou bartender. Cary joins Nikki at the table and sits down. S and fixes her face while he takes out a cigarette and lig following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picon citrons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very refreshing. Make you laugh and  play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused)  That's what you always promise.  (suddenly serious)  Cary, why does Shep Lambert go on  drinking so desperately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't we all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like Shep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Shep has that tic under his  eye, you know. Takes a lot of drinks  to keep that quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But isn't there some kind of  treatment or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep could never stand a long course  of treatment. Drinking's the only  corrective so far as he's concerned.  He's found out the tic doesn't work  when he's tight. So he stays tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter arrives with the drinks. As he spritzes seltze glasses, Cary leans over to light a cigarette for Nikki. they drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems such a pity. How did he get  the tic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not very romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't tell me if you don't  want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you see, a tic is a nervous  habit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lice under his bandages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had the devil of a time. He  nearly lost his mind. So you'll have  to excuse him a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry for Shep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't let him know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, isn't he going home? Not ever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not ever. Not in his dark glasses  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't something be done for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll have to be - reborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he going to end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how are you going to end? How  am I going to end? How is ANYONE  going to end? How's your picon  citron go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It goes fine. But doesn't ANYTHING  make any difference to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. A long time ago, perhaps,  when I was a little boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, where were you little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Minnesota. On a farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you happy then, Cary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, what WAS there to be happy  about on a farm in Minnesota?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost in thought) Ohhh, thorn-apple trees in blossom.  The smell of burning leaves in the  fall. The sound of horses' hoofs on  the road.  (looks at Nikki) Did you ever dig up an Indian mound  or uncover a nest of baby field  mice? Or explore old trunks in an  attic? Listen to the moaning of the  telephone wires in the winter wind?  See a gypsy caravan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthralled) So THAT'S why you were happy. On  account of apple blossoms and field  mice and telephone wires and gypsy  caravans and old trunks and things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki exhales, drinks, looks at Cary and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But aren't you going back? Not ever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like another picon citron  before you go? The rain is lifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki finishes the last of her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm ready now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary leaves some money, Nikki gathers her things. They ri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary and Nikki stroll into view, arm in arm, and look aro stopped. They are the only living people in the ancient c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who all is buried here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, poets, painters, philosophers--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocoanut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cocoanut. Poets, painters,  philosophers, musicians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've paused. Cary looks around, points with his cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Chopin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I practiced him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a look and they move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's Balzac. And there's  HГ©loГЇse and AbГ©lard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, tell me about AbГ©lise and  Г‰loard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Nikki. Not AbГ©lise and Г‰loard.  HГ©loГЇse and AbГ©lard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I really didn't do it on  purpose. It was on account of the  picon citron. Tell me about HГ©loГЇse  and AbГ©lard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they're buried here in the  same sepulchre side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are they buried side by side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were the world's most famous  lovers.  (looks off, points  with his cane) There's the tomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach the large tomb which is fenced off by a low removes his hat, Nikki peers at the double sepulchre thro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the world's most  famous lovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, AbГ©lard was a scholastic  philosopher--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever that is. He gained a  footing in a certain household as  tutor to a maiden called HГ©loГЇse.  And employed his unlimited  opportunities for the purpose of--  Well, betrayal. Not, however,  unmixed with real love. He carried  her off to Brittany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, her uncle was furious. He  blamed AbГ©lard for the whole thing.  He conceived a terrible revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy) I'm afraid for AbГ©lard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He broke into AbГ©lard's apartment  one night and perpetrated upon him  the most brutal punishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lovers were forced to live  their lives apart. But when they  died, they were buried here side by  side.  (peers down at  the ground) There's a story that little heart- shaped stones are supposed to grow  around the tomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart-shaped stones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And lovers come and find them and  exchange them with each other.  (looks at Nikki) And, so long as you keep the stone  from the tomb of HГ©loГЇse and AbГ©lard,  no harm can come to your true love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How perfectly beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that a quaint legend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crouch at the iron bars of the gate surrounding the their gloves under the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I might find a heart- shaped stone? You help me, Cary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Nikki. Only we have to  leave soon.  (looks off) They close up the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as soon as we find our stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach through the gate to poke at the rocks and grav tomb. After a moment, Nikki rises and walks off excitedly hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found one! Where's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary, too, finds a stone and rises to join her.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI AND CARY'S HANDS
dialogues.text: as the couple sits near the tomb. They show each other th upturned hands. Nikki takes the heart-shaped stone from h in Cary's stiff, weathered hand. Then she transfers his s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, now, you take mine. And I'll  take yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They close their hands over the stones as we PULL BACK to Nikki and Cary smiling at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that the way the story goes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, now, no harm can come to our  true love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) And, now, we'll have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to rise but she puts a hand on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were so nice to let me come  with you. I spoiled your whole day.  You were going to do something else,  weren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks away) Doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what was it, Cary? Why did you  come here today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking at her) To pay my respects to an old comrade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. And you wanted to be alone. I'm  sorry. Oh, I'm so sorry.  (begins to weep softly)  Don't pay any attention to me, Cary.  I can't help it. You MAKE me cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her, astonished, as she rambles on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't look so troubled, Cary.  I'm all right. I just want to cry  for a minute.  (puts a hand on  his shoulder) On account of you're so nice. You're  so clean, Cary. And your teeth are  so white. You're so civilized. You  don't care about anything any more,  nor anybody. Nothing makes any  difference to you. Nothing can  touch you.  (realizes) Why, you're lost. You're ALL lost.  You and Shep and the rest of you.  (takes his hand) Oh, I want to do something for you.  I want to help you.  (looks at his wrist) Let me wash your bracelet, Cary.  (points) Why, see? The silver's all  tarnished. The silver's all  tarnished.  (removes his bracelet) I'll take it with me and scrub it  when I get home. I'll polish it  with my nail-brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki turns to put the bracelet in her purse. Thoroughly emotional outburst, Cary looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary rises, deeply uncomfortable. Nikki tries to make ame

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ...  (rises, cheerily) Anyway, we found a name for my  turtles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary turns and looks at her, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HГ©loГЇse and AbГ©lard? A name for  your turtles? So that's what you  were looking for. I might have  known how it would end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at the heart-shaped stone held awkwardly in thumb brushes the stone and it falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki sits, soberly polishing Cary's bracelet with her na enters, drink in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Nik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Shep forlornly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly)  Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep walks over and confronts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary's in a state. Says he's going  away. Can't stand it any longer and  all that sort of thing.  (sits on the bed) What happened between you two,  anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary seemed so sad and everything --  on account of I'd taken up his whole  afternoon.  (sighs) So little Nikki said, all merry and  bright, "Well, anyway, we'd found a  name for my turtles."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A name for the turtles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep cracks up with laughter and falls backward on the be over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep keeps laughing, twists around on the bed and sits up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name for the turtles! That's so  funny, all right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep holds a hand to his head and catches his breath as N bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you always HAVE to be funny  at the wrong time? Didn't I tell you  Cary was brittle? How did he respond  to THAT line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (morosely)  Pulled down the iron curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep cracks up again. Worried, Nikki tugs at his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say he was going away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through his laughter)  Yup. Gotta get away from it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, you've got to go to him right  now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki rises and urgently pulls Shep, helpless with laught

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And explain that I didn't mean  it! Tell him how it was and  everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, go on. You go right now before  it's too late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes him toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Nikki--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go right straight to Cary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary removes clothes from a rack as a now serious Shep, d nearby trying to reason with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, listen, Cary, you don't have to  behave like an old Easter egg.  You're breaking Nikki's heart. She  doesn't know any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know any better? Well,  whether she does or not, I'm going  a long ways away from Nikki. Nikki  and her turtles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew! You sure are in an uproar.  What YOU need is a drink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary packs a weathered suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need more than a drink. I need a  lot of geography between me and that  girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywheres. So long as it's a long  way from Nikki.  (pauses, looks at Shep) You know -- that girl does things to  me.  (back to packing) I've got to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wonder what's happening in  Portugal tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary stops packing and gives Shep a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say ...  (thinks it over) I wonder what IS happening in  Portugal tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep stares at Cary, astonished, and moves off. Cary sets upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Shep set a large steamer trunk upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heave ho!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill opens the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! There you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki appears, carrying a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Cary's going to Portugal, why  can't we go to Portugal, too? Ain't  we got any rights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure we got rights!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting organized for their own impromptu Portuguese expe and Shep fill the trunk with Nikki's things as Frink lean cigarette and eyeing Nikki coolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary better not think he can screw  up in Portugal and leave old Shep  behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, when's he leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten-thirty in the morning. Sud  Express.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't we have to have passports and  things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure we gotta have passports!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill joins Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind passports you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind passports you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have ebony, cocoanut,  thornberry passports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grandly) I'll take vanilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brushes past him and crosses to a table where she is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Nikki. I'll see you on  the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goin', too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?  (with a sly smile) I might, uh, pick up a couple of  features for my paper - in  Portugal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink walks out the door. Nikki sighs a little and then b carrying items the trunk. Shep arrives with a selection o group crowds together. Chaotic overlapping dialogue:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki, do you want --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you put all my shoes in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. There they are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you're going to get  all these dresses in, Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the trunk, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mountain of trunks and other luggage piled on the floor near Shep who finishes packing a suitcase on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't we have to go like anything?  The train leaves in twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis leans casually on the towering pile of luggage. B him, smoking a cigarette and calling ironically to Nikki:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you SURE you have everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (misses the irony) I - I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis clicks his tongue as he regards the pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) Hardly seems enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Nikki gasps and rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my turtles! My turtles!

dialogues.speaker: THE TURTLES
dialogues.text: are plucked from the tub and placed in ...

dialogues.speaker: ... A BASKET
dialogues.text: by Nikki's little Asian maid. The fancy beribboned wicker oversized handle which makes it a rather improbable turtl secures a wire mesh covering over the basket and carries bathroom, handing it grandly to Francis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you are, Francis! You're the  custodian of the turtles! Now don't  fall down on the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill walks off. Francis calls after him, worried:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I never tended turtles before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki arrives with a bottle of water and soaks her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, all you have to do -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Francis the bottle and sprinkles the turtles wi hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - is to sprinkle 'em now and then, like  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the water ends up in Francis' eye which he wipes ribbon. Nikki walks off and Francis practices soaking his the turtles.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Five bellhops march in and, under the direction of Nikki to carry off the luggage, chattering in French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're off.  (to a bellhop,  about the trunk) Be careful of that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burdened with luggage, the bellhops file out through the in hand, follows them out, beckoning to Francis behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, come on, Francis! Take those  turtles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis hurries along carrying the basket, followed by Sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whistle BLOWS. Their luggage already aboard, Francis, N walk down the platform, parallel to the train. Bill claps exuberantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is, boys! The Sud Express!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine Cary tryin' to run  away and leave us behind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill laughs. Nikki peers at the train through her lorgnet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you suppose he's really gonna  be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure he'll be here. He's never  missed a train in his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, do you suppose the turtles'll  be all right with that porter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill gives Francis a supportive pat on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, sure they'll be all right. All  you got to do is - (gestures with his hand) - sprinkle 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis nods soberly. Bill laughs. Nikki points, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is!

dialogues.speaker: FARTHER DOWN THE PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Cary buys a paper from a newsboy and steps onto his train

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Cary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the train steps, Cary stops and turns as his friends a around him, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Cary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Well, hello. What are you all doing  down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just came down to see you off is  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's darn decent of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya got a nice seat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right by a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, how nice for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with childlike desire) Come on! Show us your seat by the  window!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerful, insistent) Yeah, come on, Cary! We wanna SEE  that seat by the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climbing the steps, Bill and Shep crowd a confused Cary a train. Following the others, Francis helps Nikki up the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all board the train and head for:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group crowds into the small compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, my, what a swell train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sud Express, Train de Luxe. Say,  I wonder if a chap can get a drink  on this train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure! I don't see why not. Push the  button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill pushes a button for the porter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered) Well, I'm afraid you won't have time  for a drink. We're gonna start in a  minute. You'll have to get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone but Cary grabs a seat. Astonished, Cary stares a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off?! Gosh, no. We LIKE this  train!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a Train de Luxe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we like trains de luxe, don't we,  Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure! Trains de luxe is what we like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whistle BLOWS. Cary panics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! He's blowing the whistle.  (grabs Shep's shoulder) Hey, we're gonna start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let her start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trains starts. Bill jauntily throws his hat up to the and the others settle in for their journey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let 'er go Gallagher. Who cares?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink enters casually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary is stunned. Frink sits down with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group takes in the train's departure with perfect com and looks at them for a moment before breaking into a und

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary sits. As the train hurtles out of the now empty stat turns to the window and waves goodbye to no one at all:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye! Goodbye! Don't forget to  write!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep, Bill and Francis quickly join in, waving and shouti Cary's amusement. Even Frink manages a smile at this.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN'S WHEELS
dialogues.text: racing down the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The compartment doorway. We hear the men laughing. Bill - necktie loosened and his coat off -- appears in the doorw train's corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, men! Look what I found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a grand gesture, Bill presents an elderly British ge him into the little room, greeted with a cheer of "Hooray sit around, similarly coatless (save Frink), smoking and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various bottles stand on a central table. The old gentlem but it's never clear whether he is an old friend or a tot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, thank you, no, not I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and the old gentleman sit down. Nikki dozes in her s The basket of turtles hangs from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I - I say, are you all going to  Portugal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. We're going down there to  investigate conditions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Investigate conditions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinking conditions, mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, what ARE conditions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know what conditions are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Never saw one in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drinking conditions are pretty  bad right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles skeptically, glancing at the bottles) Ahh, indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My beer's full of cinders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for ya. Make ya lay hard-shelled  eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men laugh. A whistle BLOWS. The conductor appears bri to announce in French that the mademoiselle's compartment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki? The man says your  compartment's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki wakes, rises, and clutching her pillow, heads for t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad -- on account of it's been  so hot and I'm so tired and I want  to go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to bed? Who ever heard of such  a thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill rises to confer with her at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we help you undress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you, William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old gentleman looks rather astonished at this casual

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undo your hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrub your back or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can manage quite well by  myself. Good night, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men say, "Good night." Frink, who has been watching N eye, is the most polite:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki turns and disappears down the corridor. The old gen with a handkerchief and stuffs it in his collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine that ungrateful old  trollop? She wouldn't let them help  her undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't understand it at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, she's not very pretty. But  when she was a little girl, her  mother always said she had the nicest  hair-ribbons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got one tooth turned around, she  can't see very far, and she's ALWAYS  speaking out of turn. Otherwise,  she's a mighty fine piece of  architecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm, seems to need a few repairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the next exchange, Frink, seated by the door, grin then notices Francis dozing off. Frink cautiously rises a corridor without anyone noticing his departure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got eyes like an Assyrian  Queen's got eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't never seen no Assyrian  Queen! You're just a-makin' that up  outta yore own head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did SO see an Assyrian Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In whose green hat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Metropolitan Museum's green  hat, that's whose green hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis' pocket watch CHIMES. He wakes, rises, puts on hi absently toward the door. Seeing this, Shep, Bill and Car "Whoa!" Francis pauses in the doorway and sleepily turns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on there! Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere. You're on  a train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go back to your turtles, hear?  You've been neglecting your  assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis moves to the hanging basket of turtles, takes off in hand, wets his fingers and sprinkles the turtles. Curi gentleman rises to join him. Francis explains as he works

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to sprinkle the turtles, see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprinkle the turtles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old gentleman nods and clicks his tongue with underst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool 'em off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turtles get feverish on trains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh! Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman's SCREAM drifts in from the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men hear Nikki SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis, Cary, Bill and Shep -- in that order -- scramble leaving the old gentleman behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary! Bill! Shep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men rush down the corridor to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink grapples with a half-dressed Nikki, his lips presse struggles to free herself from his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Energized by Nikki's peril, Francis bursts in and pulls F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki grabs a wrap from the turned-down bed and covers he Francis hard into a nearby wall, knocking him to the floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink turns back to a defiant Nikki as Cary enters and se slumped against the wall, clutching his head. Cary grabs spins him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, what's the idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the idea? Well, what business  is that of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, Bill and Shep have entered and joined the tense c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki, you all right? What is this  tough trying to do to you anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was just going to bed and he  came in and flang himself all over  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink, you'd better get out of here  right away before something happens  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What right have you to tell me to  get out of here? This isn't your  compartment, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. You wanna argue about it.  If you don't clear out of here right  now, you're liable to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Suppose you put me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (savagely) Put him out? I'll snap his spine and  throw him off the train!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary rolls his eyes at this remark and wisely holds Bill

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold everything, Bill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distraught, Nikki sinks down on a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear, does everybody have to act  like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink turns to her in protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna let these silly drunks  tell ME where to get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly drunks?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly drunks, did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And that goes for the whole  bunch of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me have him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bill) Wait a minute. I'll take care of  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink starts to strong-arm Cary. Cary punches Frink in th onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Socko!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Frink slumps down to floor and leans against the bed, Francis rises and watches the proceedings with a hand on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary, fist still tightly clenched, stands over the dazed brightens considerably and wipes his hands with delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm! Now, ain't that nice? Have you  ever seen anything so cute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis exits uncertainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you be all right now, Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure) Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bill and Shep) Grab hold of that fella and drag him  out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary exits. Bill and Shep haul Frink to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to papa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki watches Bill and Shep lead Frink out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis sits by the window, rubbing his head. Cary arrive to him. Cary takes Francis' water bottle and hands it to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Francis. Do your stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Shep carry Frink in and dump him on the seat opp walks off, wiping his hands happily. The others are grim, his actions. Shep watches a disgusted Francis soak his ha as if he were one of Nikki's turtles. Frink snaps out of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink, don't you know better than  to try a stunt like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I - I lost my head over the  girl is all. I'm sorry. I apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you apologize to Nikki in the  morning. And don't you ever get out  of line again. The next time, it  might be different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Someone says, "Good night." We TRAC look at the bar, covered with many empty glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the music and the montage end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary, wearing a robe, sees Shep still asleep in bed. Cary sits on the edge of his own bed opposite Shep's, picks up blows into it, hard. The horn SQUEALS horribly. Shep wake sits up in bed, completely unnerved. Cary laughs at him a hands, picks up a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, ya big sissy.  (pours a drink) Here, drink this. It'll make you  laugh and play like any old thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep groans and sighs as Cary hands him a glass with his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Cary, what day is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Wednesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wednesday? Wednesday what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twentieth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What month, I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean to say you don't know what  month this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew once but I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's June. The merry month of  June.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June? Say, maybe I better get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary looks at Shep, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What town are we in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in Lisbon, Portugal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisbon. That's where I thought it  was. I just wanted to check up is  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little concerned) Say, what's the matter with you,  Shep? Don't you really know where  you are or what day it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of lose track of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, this is getting serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary lets the goofy hat fall off his head into his hand a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious? Is anything serious any  more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's serious when you don't  know where you're at. What's gonna  become of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, Shep has polished off his drink. He sets down the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'll be all right when I've had  a couple of drinks. Say, what town  did you say this was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just told you, Lisbon. Come on,  now, pull yourself together, Shep.  We gotta get organized for the  bull-fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep, excited, gets out from under the bedcovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like a little kid) Bull-fight? Are we going to a  bull-fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. A Portuguese bull-fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that guy Frink coming along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Fraid so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, isn't there any way we can get  rid of that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody'll have to shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep rises and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad idea at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary watches him go and blows his party horn, wryly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bugler blows his own horn, grandly, while standing befo fight posters that read: CORRIDA DE TOUROS

dialogues.text: A crowd files in under an arched entranceway. Our little for a day at the fights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praca de Touros!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, sure enough, the words over a decorated archway read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if there's a bar inside or  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friendly, English-speaking Portuguese man named Pedro o joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, there IS a bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find the bar. We gotta get  organized for the bull-fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro leads and they happily follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Led by their guide, Pedro, the group files in and lines u extremely drunken old man is the only other customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy! Lookit that bar, would ya?   Isn't that a beautiful thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you all gonna have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer is what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (orders) Cinco cervejas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinco cervejas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki and Cary stand together at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make you leap like a tuna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wanna leap like a tuna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make you bark like a fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wanna bark like a fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make you laugh and play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I wanna do! Laugh and  play!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Hey! Vermouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, glass raised, proposes a toast. On the wall behind the drunken old man, standing in roughly the same pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, men, fire and fall back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bill drinks, the old man's shadow wobbles forward. Bil liquid SPATTERING. He stops drinking and looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stream of liquid pours down onto Bill's right foot, soa

dialogues.text: Bill turns to find the drunken old man leaning at an unst alcohol spilling steadily out of a glass in the man's han foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What's the idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others, lined up at the bar, see this and laugh. The brushes some lint off Bill's jacket as Bill shakes his pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope I don't catch a cold  in my left ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Band MUSIC plays. Cary looks up, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, drink your drinks! We'll miss  the parade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group hurriedly finish and exit. Shep pays the tab. B old man, shakes his pant leg and limps along after the ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Led by their guide, Pedro, the group takes seats in the f trenches. They have to sit close down so Nikki can see th man from the bar tags along behind Bill like a puppy dog to him but Pedro pointedly directs him to a seat in the s

dialogues.text: When Bill rises to cheer the parade, the drunken old man him affectionately on the shoulder. Bill turns and greets shaking his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! My old pal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man tips his hat to Bill and sits. Bill shakes hi the old man a wry look before also sitting.

dialogues.text: The parade ends. A matador throws his montera (his black crowd.

dialogues.text: Cary catches the hat, much to the group's delight -- they Immediately, a cape is hurled at Bill who drapes it over them. Cary offers the hat to Nikki.

dialogues.text: Nikki, here's a present for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, a hat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, seГ±or, no, no, no -- you must  not keep the hat. You must put a  little present in it and return it  to the matador after the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, eh - a little jewelry.  Something you have like the chain or  the watch or the - the - the  cigarette case or the cuff links or  - or the--

dialogues.text: A trumpet FANFARE. The crowd CHEERS. Bill points, excited

dialogues.text: A bull charges into view. Bull-fighter and bull face off. passes, faster and closer each time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work! Good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so good about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works close to the bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, it's dangerous. Bull-fighting  is very dangerous. It takes a lot of  courage to go into the bull ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill scoffs and waves dismissively. Cary leans in with a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FRONT ROW
dialogues.text: Bill is unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet I could run that bull bow-legged.  You know, I should have BEEN a  bull-fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have started at twelve  years of old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet I could start right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts a hand on  Bill's shoulder) Sit still and behave yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bull-fighting is not for Americans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we haven't got the nerve  or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, listen, bull-fighting is just  for us, the Latins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks we're a-scared!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helpfully) He tackled a horse once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at Bill) Tackle a horse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full of himself, Bill nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns away; flatly) Is not the same!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone suddenly stares in shock as:

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RING
dialogues.text: the bull knocks down the matador. Others rush in to distr runs wild, out of control.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FRONT ROW
dialogues.text: Frink nudges Francis awake and points out the carnage in glances at the spectacle briefly and then sleepily applau look and nudges him to stop clapping. Francis simply goes

dialogues.text: The toreros try to control the bull but it refuses to coo

dialogues.text: The crowd watches intently. Bill takes off his own hat an matador's cap that Cary had caught.

dialogues.text: Toreros scramble and run for their lives. The bull chases across the ring, forcing them to jump the barrera, the pr barrier that circles the inside of the arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, now wearing the cap, can't resist leaning over and toreros who huddle in the callejon, the safe side of the him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, Tony! Nice work, Joe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toreros look up at Bill in surprise. One of them resp with a gesture toward the ring, as if to ask "If it's so try it?" The other toreros laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill stares into the ring, a savage look in his eyes. He railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps down into the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary rises, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill! Come back here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is too late. Bill's coat is already off and he wav he stalks after the bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bull turns and sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill moves toward it, waving his coat and grinning like a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep is frozen. Beside him, Nikki screams and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bull begins to charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary climbs over the railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bull charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK FAST TOWARD Bill who holds the coat before him -- b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bull is on him. The bull roars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill's face snaps backward in a blur, his coat follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bull gores him through his coat. His face twists in p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT WIDE as the bull knocks Bill's body around the ring l hits the ground hard. Screams from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four toreros rush in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They surround and distract the bull. Bill lies motionless

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary runs across the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More toreros and others rush in, surrounding the bull, fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the front row, Shep, Nikki, Francis, Frink and Pedro w ....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... toreros converge on Bill and try to move his body. Ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Bill is unconscious. A torero says something to Cary and the others lift Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy! Take it easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They carry Bill off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of toreros straighten their gleaming spangled jac reveal Cary standing over a bloodied Bill and holding his personnel prepare to operate. Bill lies flat on a table a with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary? I slipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. You were doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't I, though? Heh. It's a cinch.  Bull-fighting? Just as easy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill breaks off and raises his head to look at the doctor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc?! Be careful. What are you  doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To distract him, Cary pulls out a handkerchief and mops B glistens with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I slipped, Cary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Bill. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On account of that beer in my shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill breaks off and raises himself up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary gently eases Bill's head back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary, that bull certainly was  hostile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro escorts Shep (in his dark eyeglasses again) and Nik doctor, in surgical gear, puts on gloves and looks annoye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hurt, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I'm all right. I was a big  success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor has some sharp words for Pedro who acknowledge the others:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants that we should go right  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure glad that I - I wore my new  blue shorts. I'll be a big success  in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki places a hand on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send you my turtles, Bill. And  THEN you'll be a big success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away, trying not to cry. Shep follows her as th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep follows Nikki out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill reaches up and pats Cary on the shoulder. Cary looks at Bill, before retreating to the door. He turns to look grins at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya later - Cary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary can't return the smile. He turns and goes, closing t Bill's attention turns to the doctor whose approaching sh wall behind him. Bill's smile fades.

dialogues.text: Cary emerges and joins the group who are gathered glumly

dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've just put him to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki, emotionally fragile, hands Cary his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, thank you, Nikki. There's  nothing you can do. You'd better go  back to the hotel.  (to Francis) Put Nikki in a taxi. We'll wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Frink and Francis exit with Nikki, Pedro approaches Ca journalists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SeГ±or, the reporters want to know  why your friend descend into the  bull ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary looks off and thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them -- that it seemed like a  good idea - at the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro stares at Cary in astonishment. Cary joins Shep and stand with their backs to the others as we
