dialogues.text: The amusement park at Port Mayer. Crowds, carnival NOISES appropriate MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a nearby refreshment stand, we find the group, minus B unusually silent and wearing dinner clothes. Francis hold Frink leers at Nikki who ignores him while she, Shep and drinks. They hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look over to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little shooting gallery where customers rent genuine gu colorful targets and win prizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like old times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go and shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad idea.  (to Nikki) What say, Annie Oakley? Like to  fire off a gun at something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No objection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to their bartender) We'll be right back. Hold  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group starts over to:

dialogues.speaker: THE SHOOTING GALLERY
dialogues.text: where an assortment of rifles and pistols are neatly laid escort Nikki to the arsenal while Frink and Francis tag a attendant joins them to collect their money and ready the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First one to miss pays for the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll we shoot at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot one of those pussycats and see  what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Look out, pussycat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep FIRES and misses the moving cats that float across t on an endless chain and disappear. But he hits a tinier t behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep's eyes pop with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's what I was aiming at,  a clay pipe.  (stares in amazement) Whole thing's been misrepresented  to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary laughs at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary, let's see you shoot something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary takes careful aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out, ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He FIRES and hits a ball balanced atop a stream of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd YOU aim at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's see you shoot something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki awkwardly raises her little target rifle to her sho barrel describes uncertain circles in the air. A multiple view shot of the targets reveals that Nikki is a little t handling a gun. Cary moves to help her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, no, Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you hold it still?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Nikki, on your right  shoulder. Now, put your hand out  there and hold up-- No, don't cover  up the site. No, no, no, that's  right. Now just hold it evenly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapid GUNSHOTS. Cary looks up in surprise. He and Shep tu amazement as Francis cuts loose with an automatic rifle, row of pipes with split-second firing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others cheer as Francis lowers the weapon and stares astonished and, apparently, very drunk Frink. Cary takes encourage Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do better than that. Show  him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She again tries unsuccessfully to hold the rifle steady. up a pistol and imitates her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waving at, Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary sees Frink pointing his gun at Nikki and moves to in Frink's wrist with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Look out! Why, you fool. Don't you  know better than that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep and Francis move to shield Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pointing a loaded gun at Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your hands off me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put down that gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of my wrist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink violently pulls free of Cary's grasp and, as he doe with a BANG. Francis hurries Nikki to safety in the oppos backs away, clutching his side -- for a moment, it looks been hit. Cary pursues and confronts Frink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put down that gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink backs up to a nearby lamp post and, wielding the pi Cary. His face is tense, savage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you keep your hands off me!  I've had enough from you! You try  any more of your rough stuff on  me--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nervous crowd of passersby pauses to watch the showdown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so that's how it is. I thought  we taught you how to behave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink, drunk and frustrated, starts to lose it completely

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You taught ME how to behave?! Listen,  you'd better behave now or you'll  get hurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) I don't think so. I'll give you  three to put down that gun. It'll be  just too bad if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad for who?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink cocks the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary moves slowly toward Frink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep away from me! I'll shoot, I  tell ya! I'll shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frink and Cary are less than a yard apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll shoot! I'll shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNSHOTS. Cary flinches. Frink drops the pistol, his face starts to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, Francis coolly FIRES his rifle, pumping seven bul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Members of the crowd SCREAM in terror. Instinctively, She his side) and Nikki each put a restraining hand on Franci lowers the rifle, staring in horror and amazement at what

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary rushes over and pulls the rifle out of Francis' hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis snaps out of his trance as Cary hurriedly returns gallery. Shep and Nikki watch, stunned, as Francis immedi and shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Cary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis turns to Shep and Nikki for equally heartfelt han on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep. Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They realize he is saying a final goodbye. The crowd pres glances back at Frink before turning and hurrying off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a huge crowd rushes in the direction of the shooting g threads his way through it in the opposite direction and, briefest glance backward, rounds a corner to disappear be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary stares at Frink's body as the gathering crowd stream quickly starts to lead a shaken Shep and Nikki away from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get out of here. Come  on, Shep. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slip through the thick fringe of excited people fast of the shooting gallery and hurry off in the same directi now:

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE CARNIVAL BUILDINGS
dialogues.text: on a dark, deserted street. Distant crowd NOISE and carni Under the light of a street lamp on the edge of the carni casually into view and swings a leg over a slackly hung b to glance backward. He sees ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Cary, Shep and Nikki as they round the corner and pau breathless, to lean against a wall. Shep, his fist still weakly as Cary and Nikki stare at ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Francis who briefly makes eye contact and then, witho steps over the rope and, pulling his jacket collar up aro off, instantly swallowed up by the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary and Nikki stare after him, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last of Francis, I'm  afraid. We'll never see him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you notice his eyes? That's the  first time I ever saw Francis really  happy. What'll happen to him, do you  suppose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about, Francis. He'll  take care of himself. Let's get out  of here. Let's walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep leans weakly against the wall, his eyes glassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't want to walk. Let's take  a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary quickly moves to a signal a cab parked nearby. Nikki hand on Shep.

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK SEAT OF THE TAXI CAB
dialogues.text: As the cab jolts down an uneven street and drives slowly carnival, the MUSIC continues. Cary and Shep sit on eithe is as edgy as Shep is subdued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the way Francis poured  lead into that fellow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast? Chain lightning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those slugs went right past my ear.  If I'd've moved an inch, I would've  caught one of them myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sudden Death," all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki takes out a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you, Shep?  I've never known you so quiet  before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I am kind of quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds her unlit  cigarette) Not smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your lighter working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good ol', Nikki -- never has any  matches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Shep puts his hand in his inside jacket pocket to pull lighter, a strange look crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you want a light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I want, a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep pulls out the lighter and flicks it on -- revealing white shirt. Nikki stares down at the blood in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep. Shep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki jumps up and moves away from Shep, into a seat oppo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep's hurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary turns to Shep, who slumps back weakly against his se look of release and satisfaction on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a forgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary examines Shep, reaching in to feel his bloody wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something for him, Cary! Oh,  Shepard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can we do, Cary?! What can we  do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep, why didn't you say you were  hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good old Cary. Sweet Nikki. You may  not believe it but this is the best  thing that ever happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Shep, Shep, don't say that.  You'll be all right. We'll get you  to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep puts a hand on Cary's arm as the taxi continues to j street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Cary. Don't rush me anywheres. Let's sit here for a while. The--  Hurts, the jolting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urgently, Cary reaches over and bangs on the glass betwee cab driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the carnival's slowly revolving carousel, the The carousel MUSIC drifts in. Shep hardly moves -- head b staring, voice dreamy and weak. Cary puts his face close intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. You know, Cary, I feel - just like we're falling -- long  time ago. Do you remember? Spinning  ... spinning ... spinning. Only you  brought me down safe. Oh, Cary. Good  old Cary.  (sighs) Best flyer in the service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki, seated opposite, is distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Shepard, Shepard, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring) We're gonna make a safe landing  again, Shep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this time, Cary. Ol' Shep's  gonna crash.  (beat) Say, but we're spinning fast. Level  off. Cary, level off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep's head slumps down. His face presses against Cary's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Shepard, Shepard, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary can't look at him. Eyes wide, Cary slowly presses hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep? - Shep?! - Shep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary looks as if he is on the verge of tears. And yet he to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROAR down a railroad track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki cranks her portable phonograph, turns it on and put record -- Toselli's "Serenade," that strange, sad composi Europe at the close of the Great War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bittersweet romantic music plays, she listens for turns and sidles over to sit next to Cary who is seated b scribbling something on a piece of paper beside a small l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you writing, Cary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A letter. A letter to Shep's mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I read it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki reads the letter silently. A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Cary. Cary, that's the most  beautiful letter I've ever read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki turns away and begins to cry, quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please forgive me for crying, Cary.  I can't help it. You don't mind if I  cry just a minute, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary puts aside the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you cry, Cary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have cried sometime in your  life, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long, long time ago. Before the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can't cry now? Not even for  Shep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep Lambert spent his life in the  war. He had nothing more to give. He  had died once. And he was ready to  die again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time he was played out with  music. That was the way he wanted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bill Talbot was a big success in  the hospital in his new blue shorts.  Maybe he'll tackle the angel Gabriel  and - be a big success again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Francis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Francis will forget to wind  his chiming watch one day and go on  sleeping. Till the end. It doesn't  matter now. Without them, nothing  matters. We only had each other.  Comradeship was all we had left.  And now that's gone, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, Cary? You? You're alone  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I'm alone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to be alone, Cary.  Let me stay with you. Let me be with  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her hand, looks at her affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Nikki. You're sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her hand. A strange, apprehensive look crosses her hand over in his hands and opens it -- to reveal a he Cary looks at her in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Nikki, you kept it. You didn't  forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lowers her eyes for a moment, then looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No harm can come to our true love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused, skeptical) No harm can come to our true love?  (genuinely) Oh, Nikki, you've become very dear  to me. I want to help you. Can't I  do something for you, too? What do  you want? What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've always wanted a pair of  Spanish earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her an uncomprehending look but then breaks into buries her head lovingly in his shoulder. He kisses her h

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: in a dark, bleak landscape as it chugs away down the trac
